children: A 43-year-old man with psoriatic spondylitis develops slight pain in the toes of the left foot.
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis for the toe findings?

The most likely diagnosis is dactylitis, which manifests as swelling of one or more entire digits and arises from inflammation of the flexor tendon and adjacent soft tissue. In this image, dactylitis is most prominent in the left great and second toes. Dactylitis (sometimes called sausage digits) is commonly seen with spondyloarthritis, especially psoriatic arthritis, as well as with sarcoidosis, gout, tuberculosis, syphilis, and sickle cell disease.
